remarks: The derivative of the conjugate of a function.  For the (simpler but more limited) function version, see ~ dvcj .  (This doesn't follow from ~ dvcobr because ` * ` is not a function on the reals, and even if we used complex derivatives, ` * ` is not complex-differentiable.) (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 1-Sep-2014.)  (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 10-Feb-2015.)
statement:
dvcj.f $e |- ( ph -> F : X --> CC ) $.
dvcj.x $e |- ( ph -> X C_ RR ) $.
dvcj.c $e |- ( ph -> C e. dom ( RR _D F ) ) $.
dvcjbr $p |- ( ph -> C ( RR _D ( * o. F ) ) ( * ` ( ( RR _D F ) ` C ) ) ) $.
